attacks 
• One or two panic attacks
in a person’s life – very
common
• Recurrent attacks and long
per
iods of fear of another
attack – may be panic
disorder
• Sudden episode of intense fear 
• Occurs when no real danger nor
obvious cause, no warning
• Person feels they are losing control,
having a heart attack or dying
(many physical symptoms possible)
• Can have a lot of fear of future
possible attacks, can lead to
avoidance of some situations
• May occur with anxiety, mood, and
psychotic diso
